overview:
Eric Bosco is currently Chief Operating Officer at ChoiceStream where he is responsible for all daily operations including Sales, Marketing, Technology, Product and Analytics.

Eric Bosco was also the Chief Product Officer at ComScore, where he started in January 2010. He previously worked as the SVP of Operations and Product Management at AOL Advertising on Platform A, where he led the advertiser, publisher and campaign operations and was responsible for product management and integration.

Eric was also responsible for Advertising.comâ€™s successful delivery of the companyâ€™s advertiser campaigns, as well as the daily operation and ongoing development of the companyâ€™s extensive product suite.

Prior to joining Advertising.com, Eric was vice president of communications and community products at AOL, where he was responsible for the development of AOL’s instant messaging, email and social networking platforms. Eric joined AOL in 1996 and was one of the original creators of the AOL Instant Messaging (AIM) system. Prior to AOL, Eric was a senior engineer at Oracle Corporation in Silicon Valley.

Eric holds a BS in computer science engineering from the University of Pennsylvania and masters degree in computer science from Stanford University.

Eric was one of the original creators of the AOL Instant Messaging (AIM) system. In addition, under Ericâ€™s leadership, AOL acquired and integrated Mailblocks, an award-winning webmail provider which was used as the basis for the AOL.com and AIM.com mail offering.
